glsa.title: PeerCast: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: PeerCast is vulnerable to a buffer overflow that may lead to the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: PeerCast is a Peer to Peer broadcasting technology for listening to radio and watching video on the Internet.

description.p: INFIGO discovered a problem in the URL handling code. Buffers that are allocated on the stack can be overflowed inside of nextCGIarg() function.

impact.p: By sending a specially crafted request to the HTTP server, a remote attacker can cause a stack overflow, resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All PeerCast users should upgrade to the latest version:
